item.description:
LOOK FOR A RED HELIUM BALLOON

I thought it would be fun to meet for a picnic at the Parkman Bandstand in Boston Commons and watch the production of Shakespear's "Othello."

"Known as one of Shakespeare’s greatest tragedies, Othello is a captivating story about the fall of a charismatic Moorish general through the betrayal of one of his most trusted soldiers. Set against a backdrop of war, Othello is a powerful story about love and jealousy that focuses on the passions and personal lives of its major figures. Othello, with its intimate domestic setting, is widely regarded as the most moving of Shakespeare’s great tragedies."

I'll be camped out somewhere in front of the Parkman Bandstand at 6:00. Look for a red balloon. Bring blankets, chairs, umbrella (in case of rain), snacks and drinks (I don't think alcohol is allowed at the Commons).
item.how_to_find_us: LOOK FOR A RED HELIUM BALLOON

item.name: Shakespear on the Common
